events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection, requesting to file a claim immediately.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and assessing the keywords related to vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims has been assigned to manage the customer's case and guide them through the process.
Acknowledgement of the filed claim has been sent to the customer, confirming receipt and outlining next steps.
Request sent to the customer for a copy of the police report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver’s license.
Customer has submitted all required documents including police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and insurance card copies.
Investigation process has started with the claims adjuster reviewing accident details, damages, and liability.
Investigation completed successfully with all facts verified, confirming the coverage and damages sustained.
A settlement offer has been proposed to the customer covering repairs to the vehicle and any related expenses.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim.
The claim has officially been approved based on the investigation and acceptance of the settlement proposal.
Payment has been processed and issued to the customer to cover vehicle repair costs as agreed in the settlement.
The claim case has been officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer’s needs were met.
